item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 6, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Standard Ebooks: liberated ebooks, carefully produced for the true book lover (451 points | 87 comments)
2. The "S" in MCP Stands for Security (209 points | 43 comments)
3. Show HN: I built a Rust crate for running unsafe code safely (26 points | 10 comments)
4. QVQ-Max: Think with Evidence (42 points | 9 comments)
5. Self-Driving Teslas Are Fatally Rear-Ending Motorcyclists More Than Any Other (154 points | 96 comments)
6. Apple’s Darwin OS and XNU Kernel Deep Dive (361 points | 112 comments)
7. SeedLM: Compressing LLM Weights into Seeds of Pseudo-Random Generators (82 points | 18 comments)
8. Blacksmithing and Lisp (57 points | 20 comments)
9. The order of files in /etc/ssh/sshd_config.d/ matters (166 points | 83 comments)
10. Lessons from open source in the Mexican government (164 points | 45 comments)
11. Thomas Rattigan, short-lived Commodore CEO (5 points | discuss)
12. Show HN: LocalScore – Local LLM Benchmark (26 points | 3 comments)
13. My Browser WASM't Prepared for This. Using DuckDB, Apache Arrow and Web Workers (51 points | 14 comments)
14. The ADHD body double: A unique tool for getting things done (267 points | 145 comments)
15. How the Atlantic's Jeffrey Goldberg Got Added to the White House Signal Chat (79 points | 49 comments)
16. What if we made advertising illegal? (1401 points | 1057 comments)
17. Show HN: I built a word game. My mom thinks it's great. What do you think? (422 points | 217 comments)
18. The Llama 4 herd (1113 points | 561 comments)
19. Serving Vector Tiles, Fast (75 points | 11 comments)
20. Solve the hCaptcha challenge with multimodal large language model (13 points | 1 comment)
21. Neutron Stars Hint at Another Dimension (10 points | discuss)
22. Faster interpreters in Go: Catching up with C++ (195 points | 42 comments)
23. North America Is Dripping from Below, Geoscientists Discover (114 points | 33 comments)
24. Why Do Domestic Prices Rise with Tarriffs? (3 points | discuss)
25. Exeter's unassuming co-op worker leads double life as 'Lord of the Logos' (173 points | 61 comments)
26. A Vision for WebAssembly Support in Swift (192 points | 97 comments)
27. Emulating an iPhone in QEMU (240 points | 52 comments)
28. Dynamic Register Allocation on AMD's RDNA 4 GPU Architecture (115 points | 23 comments)
29. We are still using 88x31 buttons (121 points | 50 comments)
30. Understanding Hydration Errors by Building a SSR React Project (18 points | 2 comments)
